column1: J'ai aimé ce sondage très différent ce a quoi je suis habitué de répondre.

column10: it is unfair to judge the prize of $100 based on how much I will donate. Why? Because I am a low-income pensioner and $100 for me is a good help, but I will donate at least $30!
column16: Je suis pour l'environnement, je ne peux plus travailler en raison d'une maladie dégénérative...c'est aussi notre mentalité qu'il faut changer...quand on ne peut se permettre d'avoir des enfants, cela affecte l,environnement surtout que nous n'avons pas les moyens...la supposée éducation n'a rien donné...dans mon cas à moi, quand il n'y a plus rien à faire, on devrait avoir droit à une vraie aide à mourrir pas une supposée aide comme le Canada quand la personne mourra dans deux semaines de toute façon. Si je pouvais profiter de cela à bas prix, plusieurs personnes comme moi cesseraient de souffrir et cela serait préférable pour l'économie et l'environnement....tout cela est bien beau sur papier, mais en pratique, ce sera toujours la personne de la classe moyenne qui sera perdante...et les riches gagnants. Mes parents ont travaillé toute leur vie et ne pourraient même pas rêver d'avoir une voiture électrique...
column22: Raising gas prices, forcing people to get their house insulated,   or making them switch to a non gas car will not help anyone bit people who are already rich.    A lot of people use gas to get to work, and we cannot afford gas to get any higher...its already too expensive.   And low to middle class cannot afford it, we also cannot afford the luxury of an electric car, nor would we want to. \n  \n There are enough corporations and rich people in the world...get them to help fund it

Cela ne nous incite pas à acheter une voiture électrique considérant le coût élevé pour l'utilisation de ces bornes.

column173: While climate change is an issue this survey neglects the basic problem. There are 8 billion people who all want more and under current capitalist ideology this is perfect - but we have limited space, limited water, limited resources but we keep selling making buying more crap! Climate change is a small part of a global problem of consumption and pollution of water land and air. We currently only talk about the air - why is that. Our oceans could be dead before climate change actually impacts us hard.

column270: Many questions funneled to answers you wanted to hear, rather than giving us full options. \n Lots of euphemisms as you tried to lie .... \'voluntary individual contributions....be required\'   - something required is not a contribution, any more than you 'contribute' to a thief with a gun in your face.  \n I feel sorry for my children and grandchildren, as I watch the marxist dystopian hell you elite climate globalists are preparing for everyone.

column310: Canada is not the problem this is all just a feel good but taxes would be very high and dictating all these things would be like Communism & Socialism. Canada continues to get oil from conflict countries when there is supply in Alberta. Canada is a northern country solar panels are covered with snow 6 months a year, electric car batteries give  a poor performance and range of driving with 6 months of winter. Driving to Vancouver from Edmonton I stop for 1 night in a hotel with an electric car how many nights in a hotel 3 or 4. Electric batteries how long do they last, where will old ones be disposed ? What will new ones cost ? solar panels  cannot be recycled so where will they go land fill as they only last a few years? When are we building hydro electric dams for all the power that will be needed? lots of questions and no answers, lets focus on getting China & India on board and not worry about Canada's very little pollution.
